title: NYPD reveals plan to put plain-clothes police in Joker screenings, as director declares war on 'woke culture'
text:
The New York Police Department has confirmed that it will deploy officers in plain clothing to screenings of Joker this weekend.

“If something happens inside one of the screenings,” an NYPD source told Deadline, “we intend to be able to pacify the situation quickly and conclusively.”

Undercover officers will attend screenings at cinemas in Manhattan, the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island.

“There are no specific or credible threats at this time,” the NYPD said in a statement, “and these events will continue to be closely monitored.”

The Warner Bros film, starring Joaquin Phoenix, has been under scrutiny for what its detractors perceive as its glorification of violence.

Last week, victims of the 2012 shooting in Aurora, Colorado wrote to the studio, asking them to donate money to gun-control groups.

The shooter, James Holmes, was compared to Joker in the aftermath, owing to his dyed hair and a (false) report that he had declared “Joker” to be his name when arrested.

The Landmark Theaters cinema chain has already announced that it will not permit the wearing of costumes or masks at screenings of Joker. The film will not be shown in Aurora.
